lead_paragraph: The historic Bay Meadows race track in San Mateo, Calif., will be allowed to hold races during the 2008 season, despite its refusal to install mandatory synthetic turf considered safer for horses. The state Horse Racing Board made the ruling yesterday. Track officials had argued that it would be unnecessary to spend $8 million to $10 million for the mandatory upgrades because the track is set for imminent closure to make way for commercial and residential development.
